context.introduction: Learn the fundamental cooking methods of Mexico! Discover how simple techniques create deep, complex flavors.

sections.title: Charring: Building Flavor
sections.content: Charring vegetables over flame or on a comal caramelizes sugars and adds smoky depth. This is the foundation of many salsas and sauces.

sections.title: Cutting Techniques
sections.content: Dicing onions and tomatoes evenly helps them cook and blend well in salsas. Each cut affects the final texture and flavor.

sections.title: Roasting Chiles
sections.content: Roasting chiles brings out their flavor and makes them easier to peel. Always roast until the skin is blistered, then cover to steam before peeling.

sections.title: Tips for Cooking
listItems: Char tomatoes for better salsa flavor
Roast chiles dry, not in oil
